HTMLTableElement.summary: The HTMLTableElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular object interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of tables in an HTML document.

remarks.para: -The HTML element implementing this interface: table.

HTMLTableElementAlign.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The HTMLTableElement.align property represents the
alignment of the table.
HTMLTableElementAlign.value: One of the following string values:

HTMLTableElementBgColor.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The bgcolor property of the represents the
background color of the table.

blockquote.para: Do not use this attribute anymore. Instead, use the CSS background-color property by modifying the element's style attribute or using a style rule.

HTMLTableElementBgColor.value: A string representing a color value.When set to the null value, that null value is converted to the empty string (""), so elt.bgColor = null is equivalent to elt.bgColor = "".

HTMLTableElementBorder.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The HTMLTableElement.border property represents the
border width of the table element.
HTMLTableElementBorder.value: A string representing the width of the border in pixels.

HTMLTableElementCaption.summary:
The HTMLTableElement.caption property represents the
table caption. If no caption element is associated with the table, this property is
null.

HTMLTableElementCellPadding.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The HTMLTableElement.cellPadding property represents the
padding around the individual cells of the table.
HTMLTableElementCellPadding.value: A string representing pixels (e.g., "10") or a percentage value (e.g., "10%").When set to the null value, that null value is converted to the empty string (""), so elt.cellPadding = null is equivalent to elt.cellPadding = "".

HTMLTableElementCellSpacing.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated While you should instead use the CSS
{{cssxref("border-spacing")}} property, the obsolete
interface's cellSpacing property represents the spacing
around the individual th and td elements
representing a table's cells. Any two cells are separated by the sum of the
cellSpacing of each of the two cells.
HTMLTableElementCellSpacing.value: A string which is either a number of pixels (such as "10") or a percentage value (like "10%").When set to the null value, that null value is converted to the empty string (""), so elt.cellSpacing = null is equivalent to elt.cellSpacing = "".

HTMLTableElementCreateCaption.summary:
The HTMLTableElement.createCaption() method returns the
caption element associated with a given table.
If no <caption> element exists on the table, this method creates
it, and then returns it.

blockquote.para:
If no caption exists, createCaption() inserts a
new caption directly into the table. The caption does not need to be added
separately as would be the case if had
been used to create the new <caption> element.

HTMLTableElementCreateTBody.summary:
The createTBody() method of
objects creates and returns a new
tbody element associated with a given table.

blockquote.para:
Unlike and
, createTBody()
systematically creates a new <tbody> element, even if the table
already contains one or more bodies. If so, the new one is inserted after the existing
ones.

HTMLTableElementCreateTFoot.summary:
The createTFoot() method of
objects returns the {{HTMLElement("tfoot")}} element
associated with a given table. If no footer exists in the table, this
method creates it, and then returns it.

blockquote.para:
If no footer exists, createTFoot() inserts a new
footer directly into the table. The footer does not need to be added separately as
would be the case if had been used to create
the new <tfoot> element.

HTMLTableElementCreateTHead.summary:
The createTHead() method of
objects returns the {{HTMLElement("thead")}} element
associated with a given table. If no header exists in the table, this
method creates it, and then returns it.

blockquote.para:
If no header exists, createTHead() inserts a new
header directly into the table. The header does not need to be added separately as
would be the case if had been used to create
the new <thead> element.

HTMLTableElementDeleteCaption.summary:
The HTMLTableElement.deleteCaption() method removes the
caption element from a given table. If there is no
<caption> element associated with the table, this method does
nothing.

HTMLTableElementDeleteRow.summary:
The HTMLTableElement.deleteRow() method removes a
specific row (tr) from a given table.

HTMLTableElementDeleteTFoot.summary:
The HTMLTableElement.deleteTFoot() method removes the
tfoot element from a given table.

HTMLTableElementDeleteTHead.summary:
The HTMLTableElement.deleteTHead() removes the
thead element from a given table.

HTMLTableElementFrame.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The interface's frame
property is a string that indicates which of the table's exterior borders should be
drawn.

HTMLTableElementInsertRow.summary:
The insertRow() method of the interface inserts a new row
(tr) in a given table, and returns a reference to
the new row.

remarks.para:
If a table has multiple tbody elements, by default, the new row is
inserted into the last <tbody>.
To insert the row into a specific section, use

blockquote.para:
insertRow() inserts the row directly into the
table. The row does not need to be appended separately as would be the case if
had been used to create the new
<tr> element.

HTMLTableElementInsertRow.returns:
An that references the new
row.

HTMLTableElementRows.summary:
The read-only
property rows returns a live
of all the rows in the table, including the rows
contained within any thead, tfoot, and
tbody elements.

remarks.para:
Although the property itself is read-only, the returned object is live and allows the
modification of its content.

HTMLTableElementRows.value:
An providing a live-updating list of the
objects representing all of the {{HTMLElement("tr")}}
elements contained in the table. This provides quick access to all of the table rows,
without having to manually search for them.

HTMLTableElementRules.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The HTMLTableElement.rules property indicates which cell
borders to render in the table.

HTMLTableElementSummary.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The HTMLTableElement.summary property represents the
table description.

HTMLTableElementTBodies.summary:
The HTMLTableElement.tBodies read-only property returns a
live of the bodies in a {{htmlElement("table")}}.

remarks.para:
Although the property is read-only, the returned object is live and allows the
modification of its content.

The collection returned includes implicit tbody elements. For
example:

The HTML DOM generated from the above HTML will have a tbody element
even though the tags are not included in the source HTML.

HTMLTableElementTFoot.summary:
The HTMLTableElement.tFoot property represents the
tfoot element of a table. Its value will be
null if there is no such element.

HTMLTableElementTHead.summary:
The HTMLTableElement.tHead represents the
thead element of a table. Its value will be
null if there is no such element.

HTMLTableElementWidth.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The HTMLTableElement.width property represents the
desired width of the table.
HTMLTableElementWidth.value: A string representing the width in number of pixels or as a percentage value.
